clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Praga Formulation in the Treatment of Neuropathic Pain
clinical_study.official_title: National, Multicentre, Randomized, Double-blind, Double-dummy Phase III Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Praga Formulation in the Treatment of Neuropathic Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Praga formulation in the treatment of neuropathic pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in pain intensity.
primary_outcome.description: The change in pain intensity from baseline after 3 months of treatment will be scored by Numerical Rating Scale from 0 to 10 points, with 0 = no pain and 10 = worst possible pain, recorded in a participant diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events recorded during the study.
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence and severity of adverse events recorded during the study will be determined over 6 months.

arm_group.description: The study is double-dummy. The participant must take pills twice a day, as follows: Morning:Placebo pregabalin tablet, oral Night: Placebo pregabalin tablet, oral plus Praga formulation,oral
